column5: We took the traditional IPA originally shipped from England to India in the 1700s and made it bolder and more flavorful - American Style Weve added new varieties of highly aromatic American hops to create a distinctive bitterness profile and an incredible hop character

We introduced 90 Shilling our flagship beer at our opening party in 1989 For a while wed been wondering - what would happen if we lightened up the traditional Scottish ale The result is an irresistibly smooth and delicious medium-bodied amber ale The name 90 Shilling comes from the Scottish method of taxing beer Only the highest quality beers were taxed 90 Shillings A shilling was a British coin used from 1549 to 1982 We think youll find this original ale brilliantly refreshing and worth every shilling

Named for Myrcene a component of essential oils in the hop flower Myrcenary Double IPA is our tribute to those who revere the illustrious hop and their unyielding exploit to craft hop forward beers Brewed with a blend of hops containing the highest levels of Myrcene this double IPA prevails with a tropical fruit-like flavor a pungent floral aroma and a clean getawayn

This dry hopped extra pale ale has an undeniably pleasing aroma and clean crisp finish  A mythical legend echoes in our brewhouse- that St Lupulin the archetypal hop head devotes his endless summers to endless rows of hops tending to the flowers and beloved resin within lupulin

Not quite a stout but definitely no lightweight Cutthroat Porter is smooth and robust Inspired by the classic London porters we use dark roasted malts to create a deep rich color and flavor that hint at chocolate and coffee We named it Cutthroat Porter as our tribute to the Colorado state fish - with its own rich heritage and unmistakable dark coloring And while were big fans of small batches heres to the currently threatened Cutthroat population reaching mass quantities
Each year we select the rock-star hops of the harvest to craft this bold juicy tropcially hop-forward brew Its the go-to that goes-with

If you’ve ever been to our brewery you’ve likely seen the old beat-up truck that hauls away our spent grain That truck belongs to Lugene who’s been feeding his dairy cows the hearty malt for over a decade Named in his honor Lugene Chocolate Milk Stout is brewed with milk sugar and milk chocolate The rich and creamy brew reminds us of a cold glass of chocolate milk and our hometown “Aggie” roots

Tree Shaker Imperial Peach IPA has roots right here in Colorado We balanced familiar citrusy hop notes with the subtle sweetness of local peaches You might say we gave both the tree and the style a playful little shake

The distinctive hop character of our 5 Barrel Pale Ale is due to the extraction of essential oils from select hops We treat 5 Barrel Pale Ale to an infusion of fresh whole hop flowers in the Hop Back and the Fermentor as well as four hop additions during the kettle boil We like how this gives the beer a fresh lively flavor and aroma

Ever been in a warm cozy cabin and had a secret desire to get snowed in To celebrate the winter season we offer our Isolation Ale - a traditional winter brew made with premium malts imported from England Its just one of the reasons Isolation Ale stands alone

Rupture was born out of our obsession with getting the most out of each and every hop In fact we built a machine in our brewery to incorporate a unique fresh grind process By grinding the whole hop we rupture the lupulin inside - releasing the oil that gives the beer its flavor And what we grind that day we use that day Leaving you a beer thats fresh aromatic with an unparalleled bright hoppy character

As winter sets in we embrace the darkness with this Black IPA—released as Daylight Savings falls back to MST We brew it with hops handpicked on Colorado’s Western Slope The assertive American hop profile and roasted malt character balance perfectly with just a touch of bitterness Go ahead Give in to the dark side

Brewed with a complex malt bill Runoff boasts a hearty backbone and a ruby hue The brew is dry-hopped with a generous amount of American hops giving the beer a fruity citrus aroma and a kick of grapefruit and pine hop character

You know those epic days that start with an idea turn into a dare and end with a great story to tell This is the beer for those days Crisp and refreshing like any respectable session ale but a bit more hop-forward and flavorful than some Perfect for going with the flow

The city of Moxee WA is in the heart of the Yakima Valley hop growing region and this Imperial Session IPA—a style contradiction—honors the Pacific Northwests hop-bomb heritage Moxee-Moron features hops in the mash the kettle the Hop Torpedo and the fermenter for ultra-complex hop aromas and flavors in an ironically named packagenn2016 Beer Camp Across America collaboration

We love blackberries as much as the next bear So we wondered what if we used the sweetness of those berries to complement the saltiness of a German-style sour wheat beer Our blackberry gose GOES-uh is a balance of tangy and sweet and as crisp and lively as some of our favorite late summer evenings

column1: Marble / Odell / Stone Megawheat Double IPA
column5: Kick back and crank it up as we’ve done all the brewing…the we being us and the special guest appearances of two heavy hitters in the indie craft beer industry New Mexico’s Marble and Colorado’s Odell Credited with 58 years of brewing chops our trio built their wheat ale foundation on the classic “C” hops Then we rocked a pure hop triad of “M” hops to achieve a supercharged succession of orange tangerine lemon lime spice and dankness The undulating riffs of Motueka Mosaic and Mandarina Bavaria hops slash through the wheat haze with equal footing never playing over one another The cacophony of flavor is what fans would expect with a name like Megawheat So join us as we forge ahead on a path that directly leads to the main stage

There’s plenty to celebrate when fall arrives in Colorado The warm days grow shorter the cool shadows grow longer and the aspens put on their golden grand finale Brewed with biscuity sweet Munich malts and spicy herbal noble hops our Oktoberfest is a reminder to stop and enjoy the show

Friek is an evolution an imaginative amalgamation invented by our brewers Multiple kriek Lambic style ales are fermented with wild yeast and tart cherries and then moved into oak barrels to age and sour taking on the cherry flavors As the beer matures framboises raspberries from Schroyer Family Farms in Fort Collins are handpicked and readied for the beer The fresh raspberries are added immediately prior to the final blending The sweet and tart flavors mingle on the tongue with a sparkling dry finish
Light and refreshing Easy Street Wheat is an unfiltered American-style wheat beer Leaving in the yeast gives the beer a nice smooth finish and a slightly citrusy flavor

Levity is our lighter take on the amber ale Munich and honey malts give it a full-bodied flavor and a happy-go-lucky personality Then we let the finishing hops shine for a beer thats crisp instead of bitter as many ambers are Levity was named by our brewers partly for its light color - and partly for the way it just refuses to take itself too seriously Hey we could all use a little levity once in a while

Were tinkerers and experimenters in a relentless search for new and interesting ways to impact the character of our beer The Exclusive Release series is where we celebrate that spirit Wolf Pickers name pays homage to a classic hop harvesting rig and is brewed with a hop variety so rare its known only as HBC 638

A resurrected style from the Flemish region of Belgium The Meddler oud bruin is a crafty concoction comprised of several generations of brown ales barrel aged and blended Wild yeasts Lactobacillus and Brettanomyces meddle with the brew for over 18 months creating complexity and depth of flavor Hints of malty sweet chocolate and vanilla toy with a hauntingly sour finish Intricate yet balanced The Meddler will leave you craving more of the mysterious brew
Sour ale aged for nine months with pineapple lacto and brett  A refreshing tart and sour fruit beer
50 porter 50 porter aged in leopold distillery fernet barrels
Golden tart ale Light body very subtle hints of tartness Perfect for a nice sunny day perhaps with light rain in the afternoon

Inspired by our small-batch pilot system the Roots Release series honors our experimental brewing roots and invites you to sample some of our favorites The Perle hop shines in this crisp white IPA An herbal and fruit-like hop character mingles with the delicate wheat for a clean crisp finish that will leave you smiling
300 pounds of raspberries Soured in oak barrels This golden ale is aged in oak barrels with multiple wild yeasts

Apricots are thought to be native of the Persian territory where they were commonly referred to as a Zard-Alu These precious stone fruits were so highly revered that they were often used as a commodity in the markets The stones were not to be wasted much like this brew Apricots shine bright while peach and pear-like flavors mingle in the background as Brettanomyces and Lactobacillus create the tie that binds all the components The end result is a complex ale that is playfully sour light and refreshing

column1: Barrel Thief Oak Aged Imperial IPA
column5: Starting with a double IPA we then threw it into oak barrels that had been used only once prior The oak imparted from the barrels pair well with all the tropical fruits that can be attributed to the massive amount of hops used before being barrel aged

We feel the eyes of tradition on us whenever we brew our Double Pilsner  But this beer is not just our tribute to the classic Bohemian pilsner- its our own craft interpration of it  Refreshing and delicate yet bold and assertive its clear golden door leaves nowhere for imperfections to hide but plenty of room for mystery

In the winter months somewhere between ‘work hard’ and ‘play hard’ there’s a moment that naturally seems to occur A moment where you can sit back and relax with a good friend and…well settle in It’s moments like these that inspired us to create Settle Down Brown This American Brown has a rich malt flavor with complex tropical fruit and caramel notes

In 1989 we opened our doors with our flagship 90 Shilling Still a favorite today we’re celebrating our Silver Anniversary with a double version of the recipe that started it all We’re a little bigger now and 180 Shilling is too with a hearty roasted malt base balanced by subtle earthy hops and aged on oak to create notes of toffee plum vanilla and dried cherry Thanks for 25 years of beers and here’s to many more Cheers!

We experimented with PROPagating different combinations of Belgian yeast CULTUREs and blending them in specific primary and secondary fermentations We let the Saccharomyces cultures do the heavy lifting by converting the bulk of the wort sugars while the Brettanomyces cultures did the fine tuning to round out the flavor profile The result of our experimentation led to PROP CULTURE a project of 10 yeast strains working together to create a fruit forward collage of flavors like pineapple pear mango and banana balanced by a clove like spiciness

Green Coyote Tomatillo Sour is our bright crisp take on a classic German-style Berliner Weisse A bountiful spring harvest of tomatillo fruit creates a slight sweetness and tangy bite while subtle notes of kiwi cucumber and lemon howl alongside tartness on the tongue The untamed freshness of Green Coyote will have you lapping it up at high-noon or in the glow of the moonlight

Experience the gravity of Dark Theory Black cherries swirl in an abyss of wild fermented imperialnporter Belgian yeast strains illuminate a galaxy of plum and cranberry flavors atop layers of tartncherry and sweet bread Roasted malts add notes of coffee chocolate and tobacco for a beer that isnfull-bodied complex and out-of-this-world smooth

Ale Brewed with Riesling Grapes Aged with Oak StavesnThe Western Slope of Colorado just a short trip over the Rocky Mountains is the perfect place to find new ingredients for an excursion in brewing Jaunt is a process or journey marrying a delicate pale ale with Colorado Riesling grapes It is then aged on oak just for pleasure The final blend boasts a creamy malt body a bright and crisp fruity finish and just a dash of toasted oak

Bridging the Baltic and Caribbean Seas Jolly Russian is a rich Russian Imperial Stout stowed away in Rum Barrels for aging Dark as night and thick as the raging sea this brew boasts notes of coffee and cocoa with waves of oak spiced molasses dried fruit and vanilla from the planks It’s dangerously delicious!
This artful ale is a tribute to the states in which our beer is available The result is a crafty collective of regional flavors
Russian Imperial Stout aged in Rum Barrelsrn

Brewed in collaboration with folks from Odell Has hints of subtle toffee malt complemented by a mix of dried fruit candied peel and fragrant hops A great balance of citrus and roasted malt characteristics

Brett or Bust! 1859 was the peak of the Colorado Gold Rush Prospectors and dreamers later dubbed 59ers journeyed across the land with the hopes of striking it rich In that spirit of adventure Fifty Niner is a Golden Ale aged on oak staves and bottle conditioned with Brettanomyces a yeast as wild as the new frontier The lustrous golden brew shines with hints of lemon zest and pear accentuated by a rich vanilla and almond oak character and a subtle earthy spiced pineapple Brett finish

We’re in a relentless search for new ways to influence the character of our beer Crossover is our tribute to the complex partnership between two of the most prolific and ancient fermented beverages – beer and wine We brewed a sour blonde ale and aged it in chardonnay and sauvignon blanc barrels to introduce notes of tropical fruit elderflower and subtle oak finish The result of the unique combination is a dry effervescent beer balanced with hints of pear tart sourness and light funk
Whiskey Barrel-Aged Lugene is a chocolate milk stout aged in Woody Creek Rye Whiskey barrels for 6-months

Inspired by our small-batch pilot system the Roots Release series honors our experimental brewing roots and invites you to sample some of our favorites This full-flavored Session IPA splices together tropical fruit aromas with bold fresh citrusy hops The result is an easy drinking balanced IPA; one you’ll reach for again and again

Celastrina or Hops Blue is a tiny blue butterfly found living on wild hop plants along the Front Range of Colorado Little is known about this rare species but we hope to change that Celastrina Saison honors this winged creature with delicate hints of banana and clove-like flavor typical of a traditional Saison that flutter with a subtle spice character derived only from the hops used
Made exclusively for Old Chicago Odell SMaSH Hoppy Blonde is pouring from our taps all season long! Enjoy this single malt and single hop brew only at participating OC locations

Oak aged sour golden ale brewed with heavy additions of pear and peach puree resulting in a full bodied pleasantly effervescent refreshingly tart ale The two fruits work in harmony as aromas of peach pie and fresh pear swirl from the glass The tart complexity of the sour golden marries with ripe fruit flavors that bust forth with every sip Enjoy

Striking a perfect balance between sweet and tart Elephunk Imperial Wild IPA showcases layers of flavors that dance on the palate in funky liquid harmony Pungent tropical fruit aromas burst forward while oak-aged traits of vanilla brown sugar and cedar create a slightly sweet contrast to the tart flavor Notes of ripe pineapple and peach pie unite in this wild-inspired barrel aged imperial IPA

This Collab with Odell Brewing from Fort Collins USA is a twisted blonde brewed with almond and cocoa We kept the malt bill back to let the nuts and cocoa be in the lead The cocoa from De Zaan in Wormer is not roasted to enhance the fruity aspects of the cocoa All together the end result is a beer that is rich and creamy with nutty and fruity flavors

Native to Belgium the Flemish Giant is a breed of rabbit that dates back to the 16th century and tips the scales at 20 lbs Burrowed in oak barrels for a year Flemish Giant is our tribute to this prodigious hare and it’s homeland the birthplace of the Flanders-style Sour Red Ale Look for notes of tart ruby grapefruit and cherry to hop to the nose while sweet raisin fig and plum favors thump the palette

column1: OC's Big Cookie A La Mode
column5: In honor of Old Chicagos 40th anniversary year the brew team collaborated with Odell to create a mouthwatering ale that will satisfy any sweet tooth Inspired by and crafted from one of Old Chicagos most sought after menu items the Big Cookie this distinctive ale is fondly referred to as OCs Big Cookie A La Mode and is a vanilla brown ale made with dark roasted malts and vanilla infused with slightly sweet chocolate and vanilla for a smooth lingering finish

Tucked away in a dark corner of our cellar a liquid as black as coal rests peacefully in bourbon barrels You know it as Double Black IPA After a full trip around the sun the beer has developed into a wholly new beast with notes of roasted malt sweet chocolate raisin and caramel Delicate hop aromas of citrus and pine still linger while a full-bodied richness coats your mouth Go ahead Give into the dark side again

Ten paces is our tribute to the American West and all the things that make it wild This beer harkens back to the days when Doc Holliday was gunslinging in the mountains near Leadville Colorado Drawing on the natural tartness of the huckleberries this American-Style Wild Ale features a unique blend of yeast strains that produce a complex aroma of tropical fruit and clove like spiciness while accentuating the deep fruit flavors The question is will you be our huckleberry
Named for one of the most difficult knots in fly-fishing Nail Knot is a lively balanced brew created through the patient art of lagering Featuring subtle floral aromas and a clean crisp finish

Must is to wine as wort is to beer; the primordial ooze the source and foundation that feeds the process of fermentation we all love so much Amuste is the culmination of a two year endeavor to marry these two fuels into the same fire An imperial porter aged in oak wine barrels accented with juice from Tempranillo  grapes grown on the western slope of Colorado this harmonic combination is truly a must

The infamous Cloud Catcher Her adventures are storied as she takes flight everyrnevening meticulously stockpiling fluffs of Cumulonimbus She has one mission to capturernthe key ingredient to our newest seasonal brew a deliciously smooth cloud-infusedrnMilkshape IPA Hop-forward with notes of creamsicle and peaches it delivers a citrusyrnpunch alongside its hazy velvety texture Just as if the Cloud Catcher caught it herself
Collaboration with Thornbridge in the UK Odell calls it a Double Extra Pale Ale

Living in landlocked Colorado we often dream of a tropical beach and a warm ocean breeze That dream has inspired our newest Cellar Series offering Onolicious A blend of tropical fruits creates an intricate flavor profile with powerful aromas of passionfruit and mango while funky tart notes of ripe guava and sweet tamarind round out the shape of this deeply complex sour ale Sit back relax and enjoy
A traditional British style pale ale dry hopped using whole flower hops giving it a strong flavor and aroma We brew this ale for the Town Pump Tavern--the oldest bar in town

Triple IPA brewed with a colossal amount of American hop varieties and balanced with a hulking malt backbone This brew will club your taste buds with notes of stick fresh tropical fruit and citrus all packed in a resinous hop punch

Originally brewed as a collaboration with Odell Brewing Co this IPA is brewed with Golden Promise Munich and Crystal Malts the backbone will balance the insane amount of hops used in the making of this brew  Then after fermentation was complete we added 35 pounds of fresh ripe blood oranges to enhance the already fruity nature of this beern
A black ale brewed with ominous amounts of hops ages in toasted oak giving it a haunting vanilla character to round out the hop flavors
Dry-hopped saison Slightly hoppier than the classic Saison and crisp with notes of lemon pepper banana and stone fruit
Oak Haven is a pale ale dry hopped with Colorado western slope peaches and then aged in freshly dumped bourbon barrels

Extra Special Red is our Imperial Red Ale a crimson-hued brew full of juicy hop flavors and aromas of pine and stone fruit After 6 months of aging in rye whiskey casks it was roused from its oak cradle to the bottle in your hands The barrels impart notes of sweet vanilla and soft tannins while the hops settle into the background in favor of the strong malt foundation Slainte!

A bourbon barrel stout is by design an exercise in collaboration The profiles of two distinct and celebrated libations come together to form something unique When Old Elk Bourbon Distillery opened its doors less than a mile from our brewery back of napkin sketches were traded and after months of patience this imperial stout is realized The freshly emptied bourbon casks contribute hints of sweet vanilla soft oak and deep molasses that complement the full body of rich roasted malts We recommend pairing this beer with a good neighbor
Light bodied and brewed with the juice of Meyer lemons Exclusive release beer

Mycernario is the result of a barrel exchange with our friends just south of the border We aged our Mycernario IPA in Jose Cuervo® Tradicional® barrels  In turn the folks at Jose Cuervo® aged Tradicional in our beer barrels  The brew boasts a spicy tropical hop character that balances the toasted oak with a surprisingly smooth finishnnAvailable exclusively in Colorado

Colorado Lager has been in the works for well over a year now After countless test batches on our pilot system we’re thrilled to share our interpretation of the style with the fans in our home state It’s a style we love to drink and we think there’s a place for a lager in the craft beer lover’s fridgernrnComing in at an approachable 50 ABV we built this recipe using American hops Colorado water and premium malted barley without the addition of any adjuncts This crisp and clean lager was brewed in Colorado for Colorado and all the things that make it home

In early September The Odell Brewing team ventured about 20 miles north of the brewery to help harvest hops from Celestrina Hop Farm Two hours after returning from the farm 350 pounds of fresh local Chinook cones were bathed in hot wort as it made its way from the kettle through the hopback Hand Picked Pale Ale has a bright wet hop character and hints of lemon zest pine and fresh curt grass Its a labor of love and a treat for the palate

This limited edition offering begins with a full-bodied imperial stout that has notes of sweet milk chocolate smooth vanilla and roasted coffee beans Then things get interesting We transfer it to Kentucky bourbon barrels where it’s aged for four months to let traces of oak and caramel come forward The bourbon barrels have a remarkable effect on the beer In turn the beer has a remarkable effect on the senses
French Connection is a saison that utilizes French hops to create a unique and interesting beer
Harpoon EHOP is light golden in color with a subtle tropical hop aroma and a slightly bitter finish The oats for the Harpoon recipe were provided by our friends at King Arthur Flour

There’s plenty to celebrate when fall arrives in Colorado The warm days grow shorter the cool shadows grow longer and the aspens put on their golden grand finale Brewed with biscuity sweet Munich malts and spicy herbal noble hops our Oktoberfest is a reminder to stop and enjoy the show

This Blood Orange Wit was brewed in collaboration with Old Chicago’s and just in time for Halloween! Bright and fruity wit with a balanced Belgian yeast character flavors of lemon cake and bright orange will keep you coming back for more

This beer has a wheat beer backbone with a couple of twists First this beer was sour mashed to bring out a clean sour character Second this beer contains sea salt which helps bring out all the great flavors in the beer much like salting food This beer is perfect for the summer time

In collaberation with and aged in Old Elk bourbon barrels A bourbon barrel stout is by design an exercise in collaboration The profiles of two distinct and celebrated libations come together to form something unique When Old Elk Bourbon Distillery opened its doors less than a mile from our brewery back of napkin sketches were traded and after months of patience this imperial stout is realized The freshly emptied bourbon casks contribute hints of sweet vanilla soft oak and deep molasses that complement the full body of rich roasted malts We recommend pairing this beer with a good neighbor
A collaboration between Alamo Drafthouse and Odell Brewing Co using Comet hops Delicious slightly tropical in flavor! To promote the new movie Star Trek Beyond
Brett Barrel Brown Ale

Draft Party Milkshake IPA is an unfiltered abundantly hopped American IPA brewed with lactose  Aromas of peach pineapple and pear charge from the glass while tropical fruit-like flavors dominate and a slightly sweet milk-sugar character balances the bitterness  Draft Party is the perfect pairing for your fantasy teams victory party
Pale and Munich malts willamette and crystal hops
A barrel aged version of our superb double IPA

column1: Flagship Hop Shop Mosaic Pale Ale
column5: Flagship Restaurant Group signature beer in partnership with Odell Brewing Co

Brewed with blood oranges this is a Saison for any season A robust and traditional Saison flavor with hints of clove and banana is balanced by the subtle citrus sweetness and a touch of orange zest in the nosennThe collaboration involved Odells brew master Jeff Doyle in partnership with beer lovers from the Flagship staff The result is a beer that Nick Hogan Flagship CEO describes as a juicy beverage with notes of citrus thats drinkable even for those not familiar with this style of beer

column1: Down the Hatch Green Chili Wheat
column5: Made with our friends from Torchys Tacos this is a roasted Hatch Green Chili wheat beer Dont be scared of the big chili aroma because its quite refreshing with all the green chili flavor and none of the heat Perfect pairing to go with your favorite Mexican cuisine
The first beer ever brewed by Odell

A truly authentic Belgian style wheat or “white” ale this Rascal is unfiltered yup that’s yeast on the bottom and cleverly spiced with coriander and Curaçao orange peel producing a refreshingly zesty classic ale

Maharaja is derived from the sanskrit words mahat - great and rajan - king Much like its namesake this imperial IPA is regal intense and mighty With hops and malts as his servants he rules both with a heavy hand The Maharaja flaunts his authority over a deranged amount of hops tangy vibrant and pungent along with an insane amount of malted barley - fashioning a dark amber hue and exquisite malt essence This newest Avery Dictator completes the Dictator Series joining the likes of The Kaiser  The Czar Be aware that The Maharaja is a limited release only available for the summer Welcome to his kingdom! nEditor’s Note the 2007 version was 978n2014 - 102
Belgian White Ale - Adding a tropical island flair to a spicy traditional witbier Lilikoi erupts with monumental passionfruit aroma and acidity along with a sublimely succulent finish
This beautiful deep russet brew has the sweet and somewhat nutty character of Adam Averys late 1992-2002 Chocolate Lab for which it is named
Luscious ripe red raspberries are elegantly intertwined with a bountiful amount of lactic acidity and delicate nuances to cultivate this stunning sour ale
Avery IPA features a citrusy floral bouquet and a rich malty finish

Vanilla bean stout aged in bourbon barrels rnA double dose of vanilla derived from both fresh Bourbon barrels and the trio of Tongan Ugandan and Mexican whole vanilla beans is complemented by the essences of chocolate caramel and molasses to round out this luxurious silky stout

The Reverend was created in tribute to the life of our friend Tom Boogaard’s grandfather an ordained Episcopal Reverend Tom was inspired by the life of his grandfather and wanted to create a tribute beer that contained his sterling traits True to the spirit and character of the departed Reverend this beer is strong willed assertive and pure of heart
Brazenly bitter! Dashingly dry-hopped Raja is an audacious addition to our lengthy lineage of intrepid IPAs Hops for all! All for hops!

This dangerously drinkable garnet beauty is a hop lover’s delight The intense dry-hop nose and the alcohol content are perfectly balanced for a caramel malt backbone This is a serious beer for serious beer aficionados Oink!

column1: Fat Tire and Friends: Fat Wild Ale (Avery Collaboration)
column5: Go wild for Fat Thanks to Boulders finest for this unabashedly tropic take on Fat Tire Avery took a healthy dose of Brettanomyces Bruxellensis Drie to create a Fat Tire spin with a sturdy malt backbone fruity hop aroma and a tropical pineapple layer Heed the call of the wild
Stout with coffee added aged in bourbon barrels
A timeless traditional tart gose goes-uh with its zesty and salty disposition is brightened by a tangy citrus twist A bier for every día!

Jacob Spears our 6th Great Grand Uncle is credited as the first distiller to label his whiskey “Bourbon” He built his distillery in Bourbon County Kentucky in 1790 — 203 years before we began brewing  While obviously a bit too late to produce Uncle Jacob’s wash we’ve instead created something far more complex In his honor we present this robust silky smooth full-bodied and altogether extremely American rendition of an Imperial Stout aged for 6 months in the very finest Bourbon barrels  This explains a lot about our penchant for big brews!  It’s in our blood!

This big roasty stout takes flavor to the extreme We arent afraid to use plenty of rich roasted barley and a mountain of hops to give this full-bodied stout that little extra something youve been looking for in a beer
A classic saison—dry crisp fruity spicy and refreshing—with a dose of summer—peaches!
Our winter strong ale has a gorgeous mahogany hue a hint of hazelnuts and a finish reminiscent of mocha and toffee No spices just a perfect blend of five specialty malts Cellarable for 2 years

We wondered what would happen if a monstrous pumpkin ale plump full of spicy gourdiness were aged in fine fresh rum barrels to add suggestions of delicate oak and candied molasses Rumpkin is what happened! This first member of the Annual Barrel-Aged Series was brewed with roasted pumpkins from a local Boulder County farm and spiced with nutmeg cinnamon and ginger
Lupulin Rapture Incarnate! As fervent devotees of hops we found ourselves on a quest to create a transcendental IPA capable of quenching our voracious lupulin desires

What’s in a name Sometimes the simplest can be the most descriptive and in this case derisive and divisive! After much internal debate ad nauseum! Bourb[KY]n anyone we decided a single letter change was the best way to embody the bourbon barrel-aging that adds layers of complexity to an already exquisitely spiced pumpkin porter First released in 2014 Pump[KY]n is the 3rd installment in our Annual Barrel Series which also includes Uncle Jacob’s Stout Rumpkin and Tweak Coffee Stout
A contemporary rendition of a classic style Joes is hopped with purpose beautifully bitter and dry with an abundance of floral Noble German hops Über-sessionable Utterly American
Mediate on this transcendent rich and robust spiced seasonal of a decidedly different sort Brewed with spiced chai tea
Inspired by a summers day and crafted to crush year-round our IPA twists real tangerine peel and citrusy hops into this juicy experience Its the real deal!

Salvation The name of two intricate Belgian-style ales created by us Vinnie Cilurzo of Russian River Brewing and Adam Avery of Avery Brewing After becoming friends a few years ago we realized we both had a Salvation in our lineups Was it going to be a problem Should one of us relinquish the name rights “Hell no!” we said In fact it was quickly decided that we should blend the brews to catch the best qualities of each and create an even more complex and rich libation In April 2004 in a top secret meeting at Russian River Brewing we came up with the perfect blend of the two Salvations
BOTANICALS  BARRELS BARREL-AGED SOURrnBushels of juicy apricots and bright bursts of barrel-aged tartness are seamlessly infused to cultivate this deliciously distinctive and succulent sour ale

We believe in Karma We suspect most of you do too It truly is a global concept very simply put “you get what you give” Inspired by this principle and the wonderful farmhouse and pale ales of Belgium we’ve created Karma Ale a decidedly fruity and estery ale intricate in body and nose all driven by a unique Belgian yeast strain Remember good things DO happen to good people Here’s to being good!

column1: Beer Camp Across the World Dry-Hopped Barleywine-Style Ale (2017)
column5: Avery Brewing Co Boulder Colorado A blend of Hog Heaven and Bigfoot resulting in a massively malty ale with hints of caramel and toffee

A part of the Botanicals and Barrels SeriesrnrnPatiently aged in the finest of Bourbon barrels this bold Belgian-style Quadrupel layers notes of rich dark fruit vanilla and caramel with a burst  of tangerine peel culminating in the vibrancy of this full-bodied creations
Bourbon barrel-aged imperial stout with peanuts This creamy and colossal peanut stout is nuts But our resident archaeologist historian brewer and professorhes really nuts Mad peanut science

A traditional black porter with a surprise twist - its dry-hopped!! Weve expanded the porter category a bit adding a delightful dry hop aroma to blend with the sweet caramel and chocolate characteristics of a Robust Porter

Inspired by Brabant remember that one and the goodness of its marriage of Brettanomyces fermentation and Belgian dark malts we’ve crafted this celebratory wild ale using three strains of Bretts Our house strain Brettanomyces drie brings loads of ripe stone fruit aromas to the mix Brettanomyces bruxellensis lends the classic horsey and rustic aspects of a traditional wild ale while Brettanomyces custersianus delivers massive tropical fruit essences to the flavor party Add some beautiful dark and robust Belgian specialty malts for caramel chocolate and fig elements and you have this — our rendition of a Dark Farmhouse Ale
Bourbon barrel sour with Cherries

Bug Zapper is a limited release Sour Ale to help scratch your summer itch A lively mix of mint ginger and lime are both cooling and invigorating and we sour-dose after fermentation to impart the finishing electric zap

No 28 in our Barrel-Aged Seriesn81 ALCVOLnnAs luck would have it our amigos at Suerte dig our brews as much as we do their tequila They graciously provided their finest barrels We filled them and created sour salty and citric awesomenessnnWe aged this beauty in Suerte Tequila barrels for 9 months then added fresh lime zest and Maldon salt!

While touring Belgium with the greatest of friends in 06 we came across a stunning creation in a quaint countryside pub that we all agreed was the best brew of the trip Secreting home a couple of bottles we intended to cultivate the wild yeast that spontaneously worked its magic in Beersel and propagate our own projects here in Boulder FIFTEEN was the first of many concoctions incorporating this borrowed eukaryote We shared his strain of Brett with our friends who made their own wild funky and fantastic creations as well For TWENTY TWO we give you yet again Brettsnomyces drive and all it delivers in a humble homage to Beersels microflora Thanks once again Armand! American craft brewing owes you Big time!
Crisp refreshing fruit and it has what plants crave!  Electrolytes!
Freshly emptied bourbon barrels and an audacious amount of coconut complement the chocolatey nature of this decadent porter

No 36 in our Barrel-Aged Series Stout aged in Bourbon barrels with coffee cocoa cocoa nibs and vanilla beans addednnShe was twerking well before the word was in our vernacular A true trailblazer A mover and shaker of monumental proportions Our muse and inspiration for this full-bodied bodacious and well-rounded stout You know we love big stouts and we cannot lie
Take the all-American pale ale double up on the hops and malts and then of course dry hop the result with Cascade hops  The result is an Imperial IPA worthy of the Oval Office
Seasonal  sessionable this brew is delightfully spiced with nutmeg ginger allspice and cinnamon
Verdant fresh ginger is artfully rooted in radiant tartness peaking in the unmistakable burst and bite of this bright barrel-aged sour ale

No 38 A mint julep is not the product of a formula - it is ceremony and must be performed by a gentleman possessing a true sense of artistic a deep reverence for the ingredients and a proper appreciation of the occasion It is a rite that must not be entrusted to a novice a statistician nor a Yankee n- Henry ClaynDang it! We were in there till the Yankee caveat Pucker up Buttercup!
Sometimes you set off on a journey with a destination in mind but you find what you were seeking many miles beforennAle aged in tequila barrels with cherries added
No 43 To our friends Lance and Laurence were lucky to know you - even luckier to know your reposado and añejo barrels! ¡Buena Suerte!
Ale aged in bourbon barrels with maple syrup and dark muscovado sugar added
Bourbon barrel aged imperial stout brewed with cacao nibs vanilla beans chilies and cinnamon
Sour ale blended from an exclusive selection of Cabernet Sauvignon barrels provided by Larkmead and Chateau Montelena vineyards

We wondered what would happen if a monstrous pumpkin ale plump full of spicy gourdiness were aged in fresh rum barrels to add suggestions of delicate oak and candied molasses  Rumpkin is what happens!
Imperial Coconut Porter Aged in Rum Barrels
No 33n50 aged in Tequila barrelsn50 aged in Cabernet Sauvignon barrels
No 49 Find warmth in this rum barrel-aged odyssey a legend of our steadfast brew warriors in their quest to take a traditional Belgian yeast to new heights of glory
A big roasty stout blended with Ozos organic coffee toddy
Sour blonde ale with peaches and apricots aged in neutral oak barrels for 6 months

Barrel-Aged Spiced AlennExperimentation Ales and lagers that defy styles or categories This is what we are about our driving force our passion To further facilitate this innovative spirit weve developed our Barrel-Aged Series where anything and we mean ANYTHING goes! Brewed for thsoe as adventurous as we are!  No 32 Yes even lab geeks of the ginger variety can be creative
Unfilteredale dry hopped and spiced with tangerine
A Mexican style Barleywine; brewed with agave syrup aged in tequila barrel chile peppers added
This dark sour ale was aged in tequila barrels for 5 months
No 41 It didnt help Magellan but this is our gift to you!nnBourbon Coconut Spiced Porter
Hog Heaven with an extra three pounds of Columbus hops in each keg Intense bitterness and the dankest of dry-hopped aromas with a rich caramel malt backbone
Madeira barrel-aged sour ale that uses dark Belgian candy sugar as well as Sacchromyces and Brettanomyces Lactobacillus and pediococcus  This beer will be a limited run of 147 cases
An IPA infused with fresh Colorado spruce tips
Belgian style oak aged dark ale brewed with honey dates and raisins
Lightly smoked German-style doppelbock with a deep amber hue and malty body

Our Bolder Weisse echoes the traditional flavor profile while adding a few Avery twists to the brewing method This inaugural batch was aged in oak barrels for six months with a rustic Brettanomyces yeast strain and finished at 5 ABV We present our homage in a customary goblet with two handmade syrups made from fruits for which Colorado is known – peaches and cherries
No 40 in our Barrel-Aged Series a blonde sour ale aged in neutral oak barrels and infused with cucumber and hibiscus This spa water is going to blow your mind and tickle your senses!
No 44 Peaty and polarizing Delicious and divisive What else would you expect when we got our hands on rare Islay Scotch barrelsnBrewery Release Only 92 Cases shared 35 Hoarded
Our winter strong ale has a gorgeous mahogany hue a hint of hazelnuts and a finish reminiscent of mocha and toffee No spices just a perfect blend of five specialty malts

Originally brewed to celebrate Inauguration Day January 20 2009 Avery Brewing Company elected to give their beer Ale to the Chief a third term to commemorate the 2016 election Rather than categorizing the beer as Imperial Avery created a new beer style to honor our country’s democracy calling the beer a Presidential Pale Ale A brew worthy of the Oval Office!nn​”​We the Brewers of Avery Brewing Company in order to form a more perfect ale require leadership that can liberate us from quagmires in foreign lands; embrace environmentally sound energy alternatives; continue healing our healthcare system; and unite the parties around this bipartisan brew We hereby pledge to provide him or her with an ample amount of our Presidential Pale Ale whilst they achieve the aforementioned goals!​ ​Hail to the Chief!​”​nnAll-American pale ales are typically brewed with a bipartisan blend of malt and hops both of which Avery increased before dry-hopping with a quintessential American hop Cascade Though this hop varietal hails from Washington the state it was nominated to lead this beer due to its floral and citrusy persona The malts share the power with Caramel-120 malt adding contributing caramel flavor and color Honey Malt for honey-like sweetness and Dark Munich Malt bringing biscuity notes to the tablennThis 81 alcvol beer will be sworn into the Avery draft list on Monday July 18 2016
With vanilla bean and orange peel
Dark sour ale with notes of smoke and sweet tarts  Aged in Suertes añejo tequila barrels
Ceylon cinnamon cacao nibs and vanilla beans from Madagascar and Mexico plus chipotle brown chipotle pasilla and ancho peppers for a complex chili flavor without the spice
Avery Ill Dolia is an American wild ale 44 aged in Madeira 31 in Cabernet Sauvignon and 25 Carcavelos barrels
Unfiltered Maharaja with an extra 2 pounds of hops in the keg

Samaels is a super-caramelly oak-aged English-style strong ale Perhaps the least hoppy sacrilege here at Avery! beer we’ve brewed to accentuate the malt The oak is very apparent in this rich and high gravity ale adding additional depth and complexity with a woody and cask-like nose and a pronounced vanilla flavor on the palate With the addition of a more roasted malt in 2007 Samaels now delivers subtle bitterness to add balance to the natural sweetness Cellarable for 10 years
The DereLeight! A light blended sour ale including Bourbon tequila and Cabernet Sauvignon barrels
Oatmeal Stout with 4 lbs of malted milk balls per barrel from our malting supplier Briess Malt  Ingredients Co A barrel-aged stout with milk balls
A blend of a rum barrel-aged porter and a bourbon barrel-aged vanilla-infused stout Tart cherries and cacao nibs were added  Here’s to the finer things!
No 39 No youre not Gods gift to brewing Whats that Mumbleigh Breaking down the universe in mumbleverse Thank goodness your head is so damn thick Theres no future in the mohawk Heres to day 233!
Barrel aged with Buddha hand citrus
No 46 Four is better than one and Miscellus was fun but after masterfully blending this batch its one and donernrnMadeira and Port barrel-aged sour ale

Eremita VI is the latest entry in our line of barrel-aged sours available only in the Avery Tap Room Some of these experiments were blends of different beers from different barrels and some were a single beer to which we added fruits or spicesnnIn this case we had the perfect palette a 7 ABV blonde barrel-aged sour with a nice lactic tang and an earthy Brettanomyces aroma After weeks of trying out different fruits we decided to add key limesnnThis key lime-infused sour beer is sure to bring tropical thoughts to your chilly autumn days!
Ale brewed with Riesling grape must and aged in neutral Cabernet Sauvignon barrels

Salvation The name of two intricate Belgian-style ales created by us Vinnie Cilurzo of Russian River Brewing and Adam Avery of Avery Brewing After becoming friends a few years ago we realized we both had a Salvation in our lineups Was it going to be a problem Should one of us relinquish the name rights “Hell no!” we said In fact it was quickly decided that we should blend the brews to catch the best qualities of each and create an even more complex and rich libation In April 2004 in a top secret meeting at Russian River Brewing we came up with the perfect blend of the two Salvations
A neutral barrel-aged sour golden ale with pink peppercorns and Pakistani rose petals added
A light blonde sour beer aged in oak barrels for 5 months then blended with fresh hand-sliced cucumbers and whole-leaf hibiscus flowers
Out of Bounds stout with a half-pound of fresh Malawi coffee generously donated by The Unseen Bean whose roastery is just around the corner
Immensely poundable this session Vienna is super balanced  robust with notes of graham cracker  subtle hints of spice
An IPA and a Ginger beer together at last Believe it
A German-style sour ale with lime salt and tangerine added!
Hopped up with simcoe  amarillo

Salvation The name of two intricate Belgian-style ales created by us Vinnie Cilurzo of Russian River Brewing and Adam Avery of Avery BrewingnnAfter becoming friends a few years ago we realized we both had a Salvation in our lineups Was it going to be a problem Should one of us relinquish the name rights “Hell no!” we said In fact it was quickly decided that we should blend the brews to catch the best qualities of each and create an even more complex and rich libation In April 2004 in a top secret meeting at Russian River Brewing well actually it was packed in the pub and many were looking over our shoulders wondering what the hell was going on we came up with the perfect blend of the two SalvationsnnNatalie Vinnie’s much more significant other exclaimed “We should call this Collaboration not Litigation Ale!” “Perfect” we shouted! We celebrated deep into the night or is that morning Fast forward to November 14 2006 After talking about it for over two years we finally decided to pull the trigger and Vinnie made the journey to Avery Brewing to brew his Salvation exactly as he does in his brewery
A sour Belgian pale ale that spent 12 months in oak barrels with Granny Smith apples added for the last 6 months
An ancient Mycenaean-inspired beer c1600-1100 BCE brewed with 6-row barley einkorn wheat acorn flour figs and elderberries
The 5th release in our Tap Room only series  A unique 14-barrel sour blend from Cabernet Sauvignon Zinfandel snd Whisky barrels with flavors of vanilla and fig
Ross and Rachaels wedding beer inspired after their favorite Efrains cocktail the Pink Cadillac Margarita

Just in time for fall and its most notable Fest this limited release Imperial Oktoberfest Lager is our emboldened Prost! to one of the worlds most recognized styles The Kaiser weaves together rich toasted Vienna and Munich malts with the floral spiciness of Hellartau and Bravo hops to create a bold and brazen dry Imperial Oktoberfest

Modern aroma hops are not bred by chance Peach passionfruit and various citrus notes take years of breeding to produce in a viable plant We have a huge amount of appreciation for the hop farmers and scientists working towards new and interesting flavors and aromas in the hop market
Strange Claw is an India Pale Ale brewed with a blend of pale pilsner and wheat malt as well as a touch of crystal malt and hopped with an immense amount of Citra and Columbus

Robot Librarian is a collaborative double IPA brewed with our dear friends from Cerebral Brewing Fiction Beer mpany and Weldwerks brewing As a group of like-minded producers of IPA we decided it would be fun to take notes from one another and brew something that was influenced by all of the participants The result is a deliciously drinkable New England style double IPA that has a thick body and is full of juicy hop character
Dark grains contribute rich notes of chocolate coffee and molasses to this stout that gets its creamy mouthfeel from a generous hand of malted oats and lactose

We added 165 pounds of Vermont maple syrup and 10 gallons of cold-brewed Sweet Bloom coffee to our Robust American Porter Nightglow to create Work From Home The result is a 90 Imperial Breakfast Porter teeming with lush notes of bakers chocolate coffee and a slightly sweet maple finish Its the perfect beverage to start your day providing youre not going into work
A generous helping of oats make this Third Wave Pale Ale dangerously drinkable Bursting with grapefruit orange marmalade and peach
Brewed for our 1st anniversary party We took our house IPA and doubled the dry-hop rate to 7 pounds per barrel with Citra El Dorado Azacca and Mosaic
Burst through the clouds on this intensely juicy DIPA brewed with excessive amounts of Simcoe El Dorado and Vic Secret
Brewed with wheat and flaked oats Heavily hopped with some of our favorite intensely fruity hops – Galaxy El Dorado Mosaic and South African N169
Brewed with both malted and flaked oats and hopped with immense amounts of Galaxy and a sprinkling of Amarillo

Collaboration beer with 22 different breweries! This New England-style Milkshake IPA was brewed with lactose Citra  Lemondrop hops over 1000 lbs of raspberries nearly 150 lbs of lemons zested and juiced by hand vanilla and 21 of our closest friends ;
Brewed with a generous amount of both malted and flaked wheat and hopped with heaps of Mosaic Columbus and Simcoe ASL
Sentient India Pale Ale initially brewed for the the Robot Uprising Hopped with a blend of Vic Secret Idaho 7 and Cashmere
Brewed with wheat and oats Heavily hopped with some of our favorite intensely fruity hops - Galaxy El Dorado Mosaic and N169

Brewed with flaked oats and hopped with the hyper-focused combination of Galaxy and Hüll Melon

Brewed in collaboration with our friends at Outer Range this is the biggest IPA we’ve done to date Hopped with Galaxy Enigma Mosaic and N169 then fermented with a blend of expressive yeasts
We took Work From Home our Imperial Breakfast Porter and aged it for 12 months in Breckenridge Bourbon Barrels The result is an incredibly decadent way to start your morning
Brewed in collaboration with our friends at Mikerphone Brewing Imperial Smores Stout brewed with marshmallow graham cracker cacao nibs vanilla and lactose
Brewed in collaboration with our friends next door at the Lula Rose General Store using 60 pounds of their house blend Polecat roasted by Middle State Coffee

The most aggressively hopped Calfkiller Beer of all time! But be not afraid This beast has balance enough to maintain unparalleled drinkability as fruit notes  berry hints arise from every sip An instant Calfkiller Classic!
Collaboration with Lula Rose General Store using Middle States Rwandan coffee
We took Work From Home our Imperial Breakfast Porter and aged it for 12 months in Woodford Reserve Barrels The result is an incredibly decadent way to start your morning

Brewed with a plethora of oats and hopped exclusively with a blend of Citra and Galaxy then fermented with an expressive English yeast strain

Brewed with oats and spelt hopped with Simcoe Topaz and Mosaic Lupulin Pellets
100 Brettanomyces fermented Saison conditioned in stainless for 3 months Dry hopped with Galaxy and XJA2436

Cerebral Pourtex a maibock is a golden springtime lager brewed with Pilsner and Munich malts For this brew did a traditional decoction mash instead of our typical single-infusion wherein we boiled a portion of the mash resulting in rich malty flavors The subtle floral aroma from the Bavarian Hallertau hops we added at the end of boil rounds out this brainy brew
Brewed with wheat oats and pink Himalayan sea salt Dry hopped with Huell Melon and Cashmere
Brewed with oats and lactose then hopped heavily with Mosaic Huell Melon and Hallertau Blanc The beer was then conditioned on over 300 pounds of blueberry puree

Collaboration With AlmanacrnBrewed with spelt and oats hopped with Citra El Dorado Motueka and Galaxy in the whirlpool and then dry-hopped with all of the above  Citra Lupulin Pellets and then fermented with a blend of Conan and Sacch Trois
Nightglow is a Robust American Porter brewed with copious amounts of chocolate malt and four types of crystal malt for a truly decadent experience
Brewed with a generous amount of both malted and flaked wheat and hopped with heaps of Modaic Columbus and Simcoe and again with Mosaic Lupulin Pellets rnNotes of grapefruit orange papaya and pinern
DDH Double IPA brewed with a blend of expressive yeast strains and hopped with Citra Waimea Mandarina and Mosaic
Collaboration with our friends at Our Mutual FriendnFarmhouse Pale Ale brewed with Citra Centennial and Sterling hops then fermented with a blend of 12 Brettanomyces strains in stainless for 3 months
Mixed-Fermentation saison brewed with Colorado Wildflower honey  mandarin puree Aged 6 months in Sauvignon Blanc barrels
Brewed with rye and oats and hopped intensely with Hallertau Blanc Huell Melon and Cascade Notes of meyer lemon honeydew melon and pineapple
Brewed with wheat and rye hopped with Simcoe Southern Cross and Cascade Fermented with our house Saison blend Bright and crushable

Robot Librarian is a double IPA brewed with Cerebral Brewing Fiction Beer Company and Weldwerks Brewing A soft thick mouthfeel compliments ambitious hopping with Citra el Dorado Galaxy and Mosaic in this juice bomb
Imperial Milk Stout that has been aging in Woodford Reserve Bourbon Barrels for 18 months with both Madagascar Bourbon and Ugandan Vanilla beans  Haitian cacao nibs from Cultura Craft Chocolate

Brewed in celebration of our Head Brewer’s daughter’s first birthday Once around the Sun is our first Wild Double India Pale Ale and is fermented with two strains of Brett - Brett Drei and Brett Claussenii Hopped with mostly her namesake Ella as well as Galaxy and Enigma Notes of pear guava faint blueberry with soft acidity and a full mouthfeel

It was fun working with our friends from Cerebral Brewing in Denver to come up with this massively dry hopped Unfiltered Lager with a base containing Colorado-grown malt Packed with the coconut-like flavors from Cashmere hops plus the tropical fruit and berry aromas from new varietal Ariana this brew is a sensory delight Let the crisp dry finish entice you to take another siprn

column1: Double Maple Barrel Aged Work From Home (2018)
column5: We took Work From Home our Imperial Breakfast Porter and aged it for 12 months in Maple Syrup Bourbon Barrels then conditioned it on a beautiful Peruvian coffee from Middle State
Brewed with spelt and oats The majority of the WP and DH is a new German varietal – Ariana along with El Dorado and Hull Melon
Brewed in honor of the newest addition to the Cerebral family this IPA was dry-hopped at a ridiculous rate with Galaxy Vic Secret El Dorado and Ella
Conditioned for five months in stainless on our house mixed-culture of Saccharomyces and Brettanomyces then dry-hopped with Motueka
Brewed with rye and oats hopped with Cashmere Mosaic and XJA2436 Fermented with a blend of 3 Saison strains
Brewed in collaboration with our friends at Speciation Artisan Ales A delicate Table Saison brewed with a blend of our house cultures and dry hopped with Galaxy and East Kent Goldings

column1: Rum Single Barrel Work From Home (2018)
column5: We took Work From Home our Imperial Breakfast Porter and aged it for 12 months in St Croix Rum barrel The result is an incredibly decadent way to start your morning
We took Nightglow our beloved Robust Porter and boosted the ABV then conditioned it on cinnamon and a blend of dark sweet and tart cherries

Brewed with a generous helping of Troubadour Malting’s Blue Ballad and Wheat Malt then aged in neutral oak barrels for 12 months on a mixed-culture of yeast and bacteria

Brewed with all CO ingredients including malted pilsner wheat and raw wheat from Troubadour Maltings Ft Collins Hopped with Crystal and Columbus from High Wire Hops Paonia Fermented in open top puncheons with our house Saison strain
Star stuff is an IPA brewed with oats and a touch of lactose Exclusively hopped in the whirpool with Mosaic and dry-hopped with Mosaic Wakatu and Galaxy
Brewed in collaboration with our friends at Mumford Brewing in LA using 50 of the grist as oats and hopped with Enigma Vic Secret and Motueka
Brewed with oats and a touch of lactose Exclusively hopped in the whirlpool with Mosaic and dry-hopped with Mosaic Wakatu and Citra then conditioned on Tangerine

Our Imperial Stout brewed with Maris Otter and copious amounts of English Chocolate and Crystal malt Decadent thick and a balance between roast and chocolate Aged 16 months in Breckenridge Bourbon barrels

We took Work From Home our Imperial Breakfast Porter and aged it for 12 months in Heaven Hill Bourbon Barrels then conditioned it on a rare Colombian coffee from Middle State along with Madagascar Bourbon vanilla beans and cassia bark
International Waters is an unfiltered Pilsner brewed with a touch of raw Colorado wheat and hopped with two of our favorite noble-esque hops – Sterling and Motueka
Brewed with spelt and hopped with three New Zealand varietals - Wakatu Motueka and Rakau at 4 pounds per barrel

Conditioned on 330 pounds of blackberry as well as cinnamon and vanilla beans
